Class MysqlMovieDao

java.lang.Object
dms.dao.MysqlMovieDao
All Implemented Interfaces:
MovieDao
public class MysqlMovieDao extends Object implements MovieDao
MySQL implementation of MovieDao using plain JDBC.

This DAO provides CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) and search operations for Movie objects stored in a MySQL database. It expects a table named movies in a schema such as dms_movies, with the following columns:

  • movie_id VARCHAR(10) PRIMARY KEY
  • title VARCHAR(...)
  • director VARCHAR(...)
  • release_year INT
  • duration_minutes INT
  • genre VARCHAR(...)
  • rating DOUBLE

All connections must be opened using connect(String, String, String) and closed with close() to avoid memory leaks.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Luis

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect(String jdbcUrl, String user, String pass) throws SQLException
      Opens a JDBC connection to a MySQL database.

      Example JDBC URL: jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/dms_movies?serverTimezone=UTC&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8

      Parameters:
      jdbcUrl - JDBC connection URL (cannot be blank)
      user - database username
      pass - database password
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the MySQL driver is missing or connection fails
      IllegalArgumentException - if jdbcUrl is null or blank

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Checks whether there is an open JDBC connection.
      Returns:
      true if a connection is established; false otherwise

    • close

      public void close() throws SQLException
      Closes the JDBC connection if it is currently open.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if closing the connection fails

    • findAll

      public List<Movie> findAll() throws SQLException
      Retrieves all movies in the database, ordered alphabetically by title.
      Specified by:
      findAll in interface MovieDao
      Returns:
      a non-null list of all movies (empty if none found)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • findById

      public Optional<Movie> findById(String id) throws SQLException
      Finds a movie by its unique ID.
      Specified by:
      findById in interface MovieDao
      Parameters:
      id - movie ID (e.g., "INT2010")
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the movie if found, or empty if not found
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      IllegalArgumentException - if id is null or blank

      public Movie insert(Movie movie) throws SQLException
      Inserts a new movie record into the database.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      movie - the movie to insert (must not be null)
      Returns:
      the inserted movie
      Throws:
      SQLException - if insertion fails (duplicate key, constraint error, etc.)

    • update

      public boolean update(Movie movie) throws SQLException
      Updates an existing movie record by its movie_id.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      movie - the updated movie information
      Returns:
      true if at least one record was updated; false otherwise
      Throws:

    • searchByTitle

      public List<Movie> searchByTitle(String titleFragment) throws SQLException
      Searches for movies whose title contains a specific text fragment. The search is case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      titleFragment - partial title text to search (must not be blank)
      Returns:
      a non-null list of movies that match the search term
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
      IllegalArgumentException - if titleFragment is null or blank
